channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2024 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Israel has attacked Iran, US official tells CNN
item.description: Israel has carried out a strike inside Iran, according to a US official. Follow for live updates.

item.title: April 18, 2024 - Iran targeted in aerial attack
item.description: Israel has carried out a strike inside Iran, according to a US official.

item.title: Day 3 of Trump New York hush money trial
item.description: The full 12-person jury for Donald Trump's hush money criminal trial has been seated.

item.title: Cory Booker Fast Facts
item.description: Read CNN's Cory Booker Fast Facts to learn more about the senator from New Jersey and former 2020 Democratic presidential candidate.

item.title: Today's news in 10 minutes
item.description: April 19

item.title: Chris Brown Fast Facts
item.description: View the Chris Brown Fast Facts on CNN and learn more about the singer who pleaded guilty to assaulting then-girlfriend Rihanna in 2009.

item.title: April 17, 2024 - Israel-Hamas war
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Israel will make its "own decisions" on responding to Iran's unprecedented barrage of aerial strikes over the weekend, most of which were intercepted.

item.title: Senate kills articles of impeachment against Mayorkas
item.description: The Democratic-controlled Senate voted Wednesday to kill both articles of impeachment against Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas.

item.title: Columbia University president testifies in House antisemitism probe
item.description: Columbia University President Nemat "Minouche" Shafik is testifying before Congress over the university's response to antisemitism. Follow here for live updates.

item.title: Eric Schmidt Fast Facts
item.description: Read CNN's Fast Facts about Eric Schmidt and learn more about the former CEO of Google and executive chairman of Alphabet.

item.title: WikiLeaks Fast Facts
item.description: Read Fast Facts from CNN about WikiLeaks and the trial of Chelsea Manning.

item.title: Death of Osama bin Laden Fast Facts
item.description: Read CNN's Fast Facts about the Death of Osama bin Laden and learn about the US Special Forces raid that took place in Abbottabad, Pakistan in 2011.

item.title: Violence Against US Politicians and Diplomats Fast Facts
item.description: Facts from CNN about violence against US politicians and diplomats throughout history.

item.title: US School Violence Fast Facts
item.description: Read Fast Facts from CNN about elementary, middle and high school (excludes colleges and universities) violence with fatalities, from 1927 to present.

item.title: Boston Marathon Fast Facts
item.description: Read CNN's Fast Facts about the Boston Marathon, which is an annual marathon starting in Hopkinton, Massachusetts, and ending at the Boston Public Library.

item.title: Tony Blair Fast Facts
item.description: Read CNN's Fast Facts and learn about the life of former British Prime Minister Tony Blair.

item.title: Hank Greenberg Fast Facts
item.description: Read CNN's Fast Facts about former AIG Chief Executive Officer Maurice "Hank" Greenberg.

item.title: Antonio Guterres Fast Facts
item.description: Read CNN's Antonio Guterres Fast Facts and learn more about the life of the UN Secretary-General and former UN High Commissioner for Refugees.

item.title: Masters Golf Tournament Fast Facts
item.description: Read CNN's Fast Facts about the Masters, one of golf's four major tournaments, along with the US Open, the British Open and the PGA Championship.

item.title: Leopoldo Lopez Fast Facts
item.description: Read CNN's Fast Facts about Leopoldo Lpez, a Venezuelan opposition leader who was imprisoned on charges of inciting anti-government protests.

item.title: Their partially sighted cat went missing on a flight. Weeks later they still don't know what happened to it
item.description: Mary Gomes Kopp's cat, Rodri went missing on a flight in Europe in March. One month on, the family still has no idea what happened to the partially sighted animal -- or even which airport Rodri was lost at.

item.title: April 16, 2024 - Israel-Hamas war
item.description: The United States plans to impose new sanctions targeting Iran after its unprecedented attack on Israel over the weekend, according to National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan.

item.title: Day 2 of Trump New York hush money trial
item.description: The second day of Donald Trump's hush money criminal trial concluded Tuesday with the selection of seven jurors. A panel of 12 New Yorkers and likely six alternates will ultimately be chosen.

item.title: Supreme Court hears arguments over obstruction law used against January 6 rioters
item.description: The Supreme Court will consider whether part of a federal obstruction law can be used to prosecute some of the rioters involved in the January 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol. Follow here for the latest live news updates.

item.title: Mussolini's wartime bunker opens to the public in Rome
item.description: Mussolini's bunker at Villa Torlonia in Rome was built nearly 20 feet underground and clad in 13-feet thick cement walls. Construction started in December 1942 and was not quite finished when the Italian dictator was arrested in July 1943.

item.title: April 15, 2024 - Israel-Hamas war
item.description: The Israeli war cabinet has reviewed military plans for a potential response against Iran, an official said. The cabinet remains determined to act, but it's not clear if a decision has been made.

item.title: Day 1 of Trump New York hush money trial
item.description: Former President Donald Trump's New York hush money trial began Monday with jury selection.

item.title: April 14, 2024 - Iran's attack on Israel
item.description: Israel's war cabinet meeting ended Sunday without a decision on how Israel will respond to Iran's attack, an Israeli official said. The cabinet is determined to respond -- but has yet to decide on the timing and scope, the official said.

item.title: Wrexham secures promotion in front of jubilant owners Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney
item.description: Wrexham fans will likely be singing into the night, serenading their famous owners in the process, because the wait for promotion is finally over.

item.title: Iran launches barrage of strikes toward Israel
item.description: Iran has launched a wave of strikes toward Israel in retaliation for last week's deadly Israeli strike on an Iranian embassy complex in Syria. Follow here for the latest live news updates.
